column4: Dramatic Increase. PM2.5 is the dominant driver of China's air pollution deaths. It increased by nearly 400%, despite a decline in total air pollution deaths.
Substantial Increase. The PM2.5 death burden has increased almost 4 times by demonstrating the growing crisis of outdoor air quality.
Steady Growth. The burden more than doubled, reflecting ongoing urbanization and increasing outdoor pollution exposure.
Significant Decline. PM2.5 deaths have been reduced by over 60% showing the success of continous regulatory measures in high-income nations.
Steep Increase. The burden more than doubled which highlights an emerging major health challenge in this region.
